intro: Mentzelia acuminata, commonly known as the sharpleaf blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers in late spring to early summer. It belongs to the family Loasaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, sharply pointed leaf tips. Mentzelia acuminata plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies in its native habitat.
